main event: A pilot and co-pilot spotted a kite-shaped object the size of a nickel while flying at 10,500 feet near Needles, California in 1959.
interesting points: The object flew back and forth sideways but stayed in the same relative position.
The pilot said the rays of the setting sun through dust particles may have accounted for the sighting.
The pilot turned the aircraft towards the object but it appeared to never get closer.
Ground temperature at Needles was 101 degrees Fahrenheit at the time of the sighting.
The sighting lasted for about 10 minutes.
sighted object: a kite-shaped object the size of a nickel
